Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2013 09:20AM SueInMN wrote: I know the waiting is really hard.  As proudtospin wrote, it sounds like to get answers you really need to speak with the doc.  The only thing I'd add is to try not to make too much out of the sonographers response to your questions.  They really are not allowed to comment--either good or bad--about anything they see.  I've also given up trying to guess from their facial expressions (and believe me I've tried!).  Keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Biopsy this morning kthopkt kthopkt

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2013 01:10AM SueInMN wrote: I don't have any insight on the genetic testing, but I was able to get my results from the MRI the next day.  I was at a large breast center with their own radiologists so other places may be different in terms of timing.  Also, the results were called in to me directly, I didn't have to wait for them to be sent and seen by my primary care physician or breast surgeon. Sue

Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy. SueInMN fresitabr787

Posts.Content: SueInMN wrote: I am 51 and had a stereo biopsy for microcalcifications after they showed up on routine mammogram. The good news was it came back no cancer; not so good news is they found abnormal cells and I need a surgical biopsy. They said it was to get a bigger sample and also to "remove the whole thing". Nurse who called with results said it was like a lumpectomy but would be a pretty small area. Have not actually received a copy of the pathology report. I'm back to being scared out of my mind. The big worry being they find cells that are cancer. But lots of smaller worries to distract me too: it is a small area but deep within the breast so I assume that makes it harder; how noticeable will the scar be or changes in the breast since they will remove tissue; I live alone but assume they will want someone with after the surgery--could stay at my sister's but have cats that need medication every day; how much time do I need off of work, how long is the recovery; how painful etc. etc. I think I am focusing on the details to avoid thinking too much about their finding cancer. Am trying to remind myself to not get ahead of the data---but my brain doesn't always cooperate. Have appt. 2/12 to consult with breast surgeon but hard not to think about the questions until then. Really appreciate all that I have read on this site. Helps me think about it constructively without burdening friends and family too much with my obsessive worries, Would love to hear insights or advice from anyone who has had this procedure! Thnx Sue Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy. SueInMN fresitabr787

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2013 03:40AM - edited Feb 9, 2013 03:43AM by SueInMN Hi Brejim.  If you hadn't gone to the post that snowtimedreaming recommended above, I recommend it also.  It did answer a lot of my questions.  Am going to try not to think about it too much before my appointment (so easier said than done!).  Did see a good reminder on another post about not imagining worst case scenarios---"Don't go there until you get there" or something to that effect.  I'm trying not to burden my friends too much with my worries right now--because some of it is really me letting my imagination get too far ahead of where I am right now.  So I am grateful for these forums.  Sometimes I feel like I'm just pretending to be dealing with this okay.  Still better than crying all the time I guess.  Hoping for easy recoveries and benign outcomes for all of us. Sue
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy. SueInMN fresitabr787

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2013 09:01AM SueInMN wrote: Just got call back on MRI. Good news is left breast didn't show anything. Did find a second small questionable spot in right breast at 9 oclock. they will do an MRI guided biopsy later this week. Nurse said radiologist "doesn't think malignancy' but if more ADH, they would remove at same time as originally planned excisional biopsy for small area with calcifications and ADH that is at 3 o'clock. She also said that if I wasn't already addressing the other area the recommendation would be redo MRI in 6 months, but that it is better to address it at one time. I know this is mostly not bad news and some definitely good news in there. The new area is small, if it is anything, I can do it in one surgery rather than another surgery in 6 months. And the left breast is clear in the MRI (yeah!). But I can't help feeling disappointed. I feel like my body is on a quest to try every kind of breast biopsy there is. I can't seem to remember what it is like not to feel stressed. Just want to cry sometimes. I know so many of us are going through the same feelings. Waiting. Another test. Wait some more. Appreciate everyone's stories so much. Sending good thoughts out to everyone. We are stronger than we think sometimes and will get through it all.
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy. SueInMN fresitabr787

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2013 09:49PM SueInMN wrote: Results of MRI biopsy came back benign! Am scheduled for excisional biopsy of the original area with calcifications and ADH on March 11. Feel a bit more at ease about all this (at least for the moment!). Everything I can do I have done, so now it is more waiting. Birdie--thanks for the good wishes. I do sometimes forget to cut myself some slack and allow myself to just feel whatever i feel instead of trying to keep in control all the time. Three cats-am hoping you hear good news. That is wonderful that Komen was there to provide help. I feel very lucky to have good insurance. Hope you are healing well from the surgery. (btw--I would be 'twocats' and any typos I blame on their insistence in helping me at the computer!) Fenella--I hope you are able to get some resolution. I'm glad your tests so far showed no cancer but totally understand the frustration of not knowing more. ((hugs))
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy. SueInMN fresitabr787
Biopsy yesterday! Miracles happen! Copswifeoffour SueInMN

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2013 08:46AM SueInMN wrote: Update...B9 I had the excisional biopsy yesterday. Went very well. Even the wire placement wasnt bad. I have only needed ibuprofen and ice packs. And a sports bra for extra support. Best news...The surgeon just called to say the pathology report came back and nothing else was found--only b9 fibrocystic changes! Follow up with breast surgeon in 2 weeks. Am so appreciative of this site. Expect I will be sticking around because I think I go into the 6 month club now with extra more frequent teting and with how 'busy' and dense my breasts are I wouldn't be surprised to have more tests in my future. But for now it's all good.
Posts.Title: Stressing about surgical biopsy SueInMN LibraryLynn

Posts.Content: SueInMN wrote: I have my wire guided excisional biopsy scheduled for Monday (for ADH found via a stereotactic biopsy for calcifications).  Have to be there at 7 a.m. for wire insertion and surgery at about 9:30.  They will call my sister to come pick me up and told me to tell her to expect the call mid afternoon.  I live alone (except for 2 cats) so will stay at her house the first night.  I keep thinking I have a grip on this and then I realize, no I'm a mess!  I can definitely tell the stress is getting to me.  The last couple nights I've had dreams about the surgery, the IV for the anesthesia, the results etc.  And I keep finding other things to feel stressed about in life as well--what if the cat gets sick again with pancreatitis while I'm gone, what if there is a snowstorm, etc. etc. etc.  Often things I wouldn't normally worry so much about.  Yesterday was the worst--felt very close to a panic attack.  I'm trying to remind myself that chances are in my favor that they will not find cancer--but it is so hard when I know that there is a chance that it is.  Plus I am still worried about the procedure itself.  Really hate this.  Hate the feeling of fear and really hate not feeling in control over my emotions. Not sure what my question is--mostly just needed to write down the scarriness of it all.  Am trying to stay busy.  Have a dinner date on Saturday evening.  It's a relatively new relationship--do I have my timing down or what?  :-)  and I have a book club meeting on Sunday at my house no less.  Even when doing other things, though, I feel like my brain is still distracted by this whole journey. Any advice on getting through the last few days before the surgery would be appreciated.   Thnx, Sue Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stressing about surgical biopsy SueInMN LibraryLynn

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2013 12:14AM SueInMN wrote: Thank you for your words of support and encouragement. Am feeling a bit better about all this. I think I just was trying so hard to stay in control that I just needed a little emotional meltdown to get it all out. So thanks for being there to listen and support. It really helped. Had dinner with some friends last night, including a woman who had surgery for a huge tumor on one of her kidneys--stage3 cancer. She is doing great (even brought a picture of what they removed--I do *not* plan on asking for pics from my surgery. lol). It put my situation in perspective for me though. And made me realize that I can do this and I can deal with whatever is thrown my way. Yes, definitely feeling better today. Thanks and I will keep you all posted.
Posts.Title: Stressing about surgical biopsy SueInMN LibraryLynn

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2013 01:50PM SueInMN wrote: I was diagnozed with PASH about 4 or 5 years ago.  All they had me do was come in for a 6 month followup ultrasound and it has gone away and so far not returned.  It was actually not even suggested that I have it removed; until reading this thread I didn't even know that removal might be standard.   I've had biopsies for other things since then, but no issues with PASH again.
Posts.Title: PASH - Pseudoangiomatous stromal hyperplasia gillianinnh djmammo

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 10:42AM - edited Mar 14, 2013 10:42AM by SueInMN Lisa, I just had an excisional biopsy for ADH on Monday.  That surgery came after a routine mammogram led to additional views because of calcifications which led to a stereotactic biopsy which led to meeting with the surgeon which led to a breast MRI which led to an MRI guided biopsy of a second spot...no wonder we are all tired out from this process!  First--the surgery went really well.  Actually the pain and bruising after seem much less than the stereotactic biopsy, even given that I had the wire localization before the surgery.  I didn't need the vicodin that was prescribed.  Ice and ibuprofen did the trick, although I know that varies for people and by where and how much is removed.  But for me it went much much easier than I expected.  Oh, and a good sports bra helps a lot (zipper in the front).  Sometimes gravity is not our friend. My results came back with no cancer, and if fact, no additional ADH (Yeah and big sigh of relief).  I meet with the breast surgeon in about a week and don't know if they will recommend anything beyond 6 month testing.  I am a few years older than you (51) and know that age makes a difference in what they recommend.  My breast surgeon originally mentioned drugs like tamoxifen to reduce the risk associated with the ADH finding.  But like you I have a lot of questions/qualms about that.  I am trying to follow Ariom's advice to not jump ahead.  I think the advice to "slow down" is the best advice I've gotten.  Even if the surgeon refers me to the oncologist and they suggest it, the decision doesn't need to be made right at that moment.  In fact that is the decision I've made---not to decide at the visit where it is recommended.  I know I will need the time to look into it more so I could feel comfortable with whatever decision is made. Hoping for good results for you!
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2013 10:51AM SueInMN wrote: NY Lisa--so glad to hear the biopsy went well. I echo April485s advice to resist the urge to do too much. I had very little pain after mine as well but my body clearly knew it had been through a lot and I did tire out much more easily. I don't know if it was lingering effects of anesthesia or my body just needing to recover. Probably some of both. Hoping for good b9 news for you!
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN
